 Hi Kriss,

I take your point and as I explored a bit further I realized th=
at the way I
wanted to make the re-crawl work would be to build my own queu=
es and 
infrastructure anyway. It was useful though to be able to copy the =
frontier
into a new package and mess about with it. That probably doens't r=
equire 
the package access to be permenantly revoked though.

How are you d=
oing with your re-crawl suff? I have become heavily sidetracked
by other pr=
oject concerns at the moment and haven't done
much more than think of a des=
ign - I've hardly done any coding. When 
do you think you might be able to =
release something? 

cheers 

mark 

-----Original Message-----
From: Krist=
inn Sigurdsson
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 7/26/04 10:19 AM
S=
ubject: RE: [archive-crawler] Package access

If I recall correctly the rea=
son for package access was that the
FrontierMarker is dependant on the spec=
ific implementation of a
Frontier.

It was never intended to work with any =
other Frontier implementation
(other Frontier implementations should implem=
ent their own
URIFrontierMarker).

 

I know it's three weeks later and a b=
it late to come with this reply but
I would STRONGLY advise against relying=
 on any implementation details of
org.arcive.crawler.frontier.FrontierMarke=
r in implementing other
Frontiers (beyond what is specified in the URIFront=
ierMarker interface).
The truth is that if the standard frontier provided w=
ith Heritrix is
changed in any significant way (such as the recent eliminat=
ion of the
'pending' queue) that may also affect the Marker implementation!=
 That is
way it was limited to package access.

 

- Kris

 

-----Original=
 Message-----
From: stack [mailto:stack@...] 
Sent: 5. j=FAl=ED 200=
4 18:30
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] =
Package access

 

mark williamson wrote:

>Hi,
>
>finally starting work on=
 the re-visting stuff:
>
>Is there are reason why stuff in the FrontierMark=
er is package 
>access only. I'm setting up my new Frontier in a new packag=
e 
>and I've copy and pasted  Frontier.java in as a starting point
>and of =
course it needs all the FrontierMarker stuff and can't 
>see it because its=
 no longer in the same package. 
>
>I don't know enough about the codebase =
to start hacking at it 
>right now so I'm just going to copy it as well. bu=
t i guess that 
>there should be access methods for these protected memeber=
s so
>that writing a new frontier in a new package is do-able
>  
>

Pardon=
 us Mark.  You're probably first to have a go at other than a play

Frontie=
r or the default Frontier of our own making.  I changed HEAD so 
that Front=
ierMarker now has accessors for all fields a Frontier would 
want access to=
.  Let us know.
St.Ack

>cheers 
>
>mark
